title: Surgical weight-loss to improve functional status trajectories following total knee arthroplasty: SWIFT trial: Rationale, design, and methods.
abstract: Total Knee Arthroplasty (TKA, also known as total knee replacement) is a highly effective surgical intervention for the restoration of physical function and improving quality of life in patients with disabling knee osteoarthritis. Recent data suggest that obesity is a major risk factor in the pathogenesis and progression of knee osteoarthritis, with increases in body mass index (BMI, kg/m
authors: Benotti, Peter N; Still, Christopher D; Craig Wood, G; Seiler, Jamie L; Seiler, Christopher J; Thomas, Shane P; Petrick, Anthony T; Suk, Michael; Irving, Brian A
